text: With regard to license plates, Alaska requires:
answer: One in the front for commercial vehicles and one in the back for non-commercial vehicles

answer: As a driver, you must be alert and courteous to all bicyclists.

answer: Stop until the person is out of the crosswalk.

text: At an intersection with a traffic light showing a left green arrow, you should:
answer: Turn left when intersection is clear.

text: To avoid a rear end collision with the car in front of you:

answer: Stop, and do not move the car until the red lights go out.

text: The school zone speed limit is:

When getting ready to pass, you should:
answer: Check well ahead for a no passing zone and oncoming vehicles.

text: When turning around on a city street, the safest idea is to:

answer: Stop and do not turn until the arrow turns to green.

text: You are driving on a highway with separated roadways with two or more lanes in each direction.  A school bus has stopped in the opposite direction.
Upon the approach of a vehicle displaying a flashing blue or red light the law requires that you must:
answer: Pull over to the side and stop clear of any intersection.

text: If two vehicles approach an intersection with no signs or traffic lights at the same time:
answer: The vehicle on the left must yield to the vehicle on the right.

text: Which of the following statements is not true?
answer: You may not drive below the posted speed limit.

text: You are stopped at a railroad crossing and the train has just passed. You can:
answer: Look to see of another train is coming and then cross the tracks if clear.

text: If you come to an intersection and you see the sign above, you must:
answer: Come to a complete stop if necessary to yield to others.

text: Before pulling out to pass on the highway you must:

answer: Start in position 2 and follow path D.

text: Under Alaskaâ€™s financial responsibility law, if you are determined to be at fault for a vehicle crash and not covered by automobile liability insurance, the minimum license suspension is:
answer: Three years or until a financial settlement is made with the damaged parties or their insurance company.

text: Vehicles operated by police, fire departments, and ambulances are equipped with sirens. When a siren is in operation on an emergency vehicle. You must:
answer: Pull over to the side and stop clear of intersection.

text: Under Alaskan law, seat belts are required:
answer: For everyone in the vehicle at all times.

answer: Provide a sample of your breath after a lawful arrest for driving under the influence (DUI).

text: Alaskaâ€™s mandatory insurance law requires that drivers and vehicle owners be covered by liability automobile insurance. The minimum penalty for a driver who fails to provide verification of motor vehicle liability insurance to the DMV after a crash is a license suspension of:
Slow down, yield, and be prepared to stop for pedestrians:
answer: When approaching them as they are crossing or walking on the roadway.

text: To prevent being struck from behind:

When the rear of your vehicle skids to the left while driving at a moderate speed on a straight stretch of snow covered pavement, you should:
answer: Turn the wheels in the direction of the skid.

text: At this sign you must:

answer: Look into headlights of oncoming vehicles.

text: If you are about to miss your exit from a controlled access highway or freeway you should:
answer: Continue on to the next exit.

text: An orange triangle with red borders like this sign means:

In addition to reporting to the police and your insurance company when you are involved in a vehicle crash, when would proof of automobile liability insurance need to be provided to the DMV within 15 days?:
answer: Only when there is death or personal injury or property damage of $501 or more.

answer: If a motorcyclist is riding to one side of a lane and the lane is wide enough, you can move into the same lane.

text: This sign warns you to:
answer: Look for a traffic light ahead.

text: If your driving privileges have been suspended, canceled, or revoked by another state you may obtain an Alaska license:

text: Weather conditions affect your vehicle, which is why you should:

answer: Wait a period of time. Only time will eliminate the effects of alcohol.

text: Dim your high beam headlights when you are __________ feet away from an oncoming vehicle.

answer: $50,000/$100,000 for bodily injury or death and $25,000 for property damage.

text: A dashed white line on a multi-lane roadway means:

text: When backing up your vehicle you should:
answer: Turn your body and head to the right to look out the rear window.

text: A revocation of your license means your driving privileges are taken away. Under which of the following  situations will your license be revoked?
